project_abstract.cdata: The Second Wholesale Markets Project for Poland aims to construct a commercially self-sustaining urban wholesale market for the greater Lublin area, complete with associated physical infrastructure. This project 1) builds a multi-purpose fresh produce trading hall, a dry goods market, a hall to sell flowers and pot plants with multiple buyer walks, semi-wholesalers/retailers booths for smaller traders, a market administration office complex enclosing an environmental health laboratory, broker's offices, a bank, a restaurant, workshops, and first aid/welfare facilities as well as ancillary facilities; 2) establishes medium to large wholesaler's units in a garage-type structure, an open farmers' market, on-site infrastructure including on-site earthworks and site preparation works, roads and circulation areas, road signs, pavements and ramps, decorative plants, boundary-fencing and gates, a water distribution/fire hydrant system, a water drainage system, an electric supply network, a gravity sewage system, and a communications system; 3) implements environmental mitigation measures; and 4) provides pre-startup expenses and covers interest and financial charges.
